title: Understanding Correlative Electron Microscopy Imaging with SEM, STEM-in-SEM and TEM for the Accurate Characterization of Size and Shape of Iron Oxide Nanoparticles
content: Nanoparticulate materials are used in a variety of applications in both academia and industry due to their attractive electrical, optical, magnetic, mechanical or chemical properties. For iron oxide nanoparticles (NPs) in particular, these applications include areas such as catalysis, optoelectronics, energy storage and biomedicine [1,2]. For the efficient and safe application of such nanomaterials it is essential to accurately characterize the physico-chemical properties, which requires validated and standardized analysis procedures.
